Package net.battleships.content

Class ContentLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.battleships.content.ContentLoader
  • public class ContentLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages content files (like .ships or .weapon files)
    Version:
    2020-01-30
    Author:
    Philip Damianik

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      ContentLoader()
      Identifies the OS and then locates the resource folder for this game (in local/application/folder/data; containing .ship and .weapon files).

      Locates the resource folder for this game (in [localFolderLocation]/data; containing .ship and .weapon files).

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContentLoader

        public ContentLoader()
              throws java.nio.file.AccessDeniedException
        Identifies the OS and then locates the resource folder for this game (in local/application/folder/data; containing .ship and .weapon files). This folder will be created if it doesn't exist. After the folder searching is done, the folder will be indexed and a watcher will be placed, to be able to instantly detect new files/changes to the files

        the os type will be used to locate the local application data folder: 
         Windows:       %AppData%\battleships
 Mac:           ~/Library/Application Support/battleships
 Linux:         ~/.local/battleships
 Other/Unknown: ./battleships
        The default relative path for the local application data folder is: path/to/the/local/application/folder/data
        Throws:
        java.nio.file.AccessDeniedException - will be thrown when the resource folder couldn't be created

      • ContentLoader

        public ContentLoader​(OSType osType)
              throws java.nio.file.AccessDeniedException
        Locates the resource folder for this game (in local/application/folder/data; containing .ship and .weapon files). This folder will be created if it doesn't exist. After the folder searching is done, the folder will be indexed and a watcher will be placed, to be able to instantly detect new files/changes to the files

        The default relative path for the local application data folder is path/to/the/local/application/folder/data
        Parameters:
        osType - the os type (will be used to locate the local application data folder: 
         Windows:       %AppData%\battleships
 Mac:           ~/Library/Application Support/battleships
 Linux:         ~/.local/battleships
 Other/Unknown: ./battleships
 )
        Throws:
        java.nio.file.AccessDeniedException - will be thrown when the resource folder couldn't be created
        See Also:
        OSType

      • ContentLoader

        public ContentLoader​(java.lang.String path,
                     OSType osType)
              throws java.nio.file.AccessDeniedException
        Locates the resource folder for this game (in [localFolderLocation]/data; containing .ship and .weapon files). This folder will be created if it doesn't exist. After the folder searching is done, the folder will be indexed and a watcher will be placed, to be able to instantly detect new files/changes to the files
        Parameters:
        path - the path relative to the local application data folder where the resource folder is located
        osType - the os type (will be used to locate the local application data folder: 
         Windows:       %AppData%\battleships
 Mac:           ~/Library/Application Support/battleships
 Linux:         ~/.local/battleships
 Other/Unknown: ./battleships
 )
        Throws:
        java.nio.file.AccessDeniedException - will be thrown when the resource folder couldn't be created
        See Also:
        OSType
